note.p: Clergyman. BA, Oxford, 1844; BA, Durham, 1846. Fellow of Wadham College, Oxford, 1848–52. Vicar of Oldbury, Worcestershire, 1850; Dartford, Kent, 1868; rector of St Philip’s, Birmingham, 1875. Honorary canon of Worcester, 1877; bishop suffragan of Coventry, 1891; archdeacon of Birmingham, 1892. Member of the Birmingham Philosophical Society.
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1966, 1973–95 (Ancestry.co.uk, accessed 14 September 2018)
